data.title: Kobani Mediterranean Grill
data.text: This is a tiny place with the bus stop right outside.  It has no ambiance, but the food was great and the staff very nice.  My mom and I stumbled into this small place.  The cook offered us a free appetizer to try.  The lamb kabob, beef/lamb gyro and rice was good.  We took baklava to go and it was delicious.  They only have a few tables and it is noisy with the street traffic.  I think most people get it to go.  Worth a stop if you crave a gyro or kabob.

data.title: Freshest Middle Eastern fare in Berkeley
data.text: Eating here is like eating with family.  Each dish is freshly prepared (so there's a bit of a wait, so worth it) and everything is so good: the mezze platter (hummus, baba ganouj, feta, dolmathes, olives, pita), the veggie moussaka (eggplant dish), fresh garden salads, lamb kebabs, gyros. My favorite is the yogurt: thick, rich yogurt with cucumber and dill. Again, freshly made.
